page.title: 16LOCAL HISTORY BILLINGSHURST
page.content: WORKED FLINTS FOUND IN PLOUGHLAND SHOW NEOLITHIC AND MESOLITHIC OCCUPATION. MILITARY STANE ST. BISECTS AREA BUT LITTLE EVIDENCE OF SUBSTANTIAL ROMAN PRESENCE.VILLAGE NAME POSSIBLY LINKED TO REPUTED ROAD SURVEYOR, BELINUS. SAXONS CLEARED OAK FOREST FOR PIG FARMING,BUT AS VILLAGE NOT IN DOMESDAY BOOK, SETTLEMENT UNLIKELY. FIRST RECORD APPEARS IN 13TH CENTURY, "BELLINGSHERST".NO SINGLE DOMINANT MANOR.OLDEST IS "BASSETTS FEE" CENTRED ON PRESENT MANOR HOUSE ON A29. "WYNSTODE"IS SITE OF DEDISHAM MANOR. "SOMERS PLACE"OWNERS GO BACK TO ROGER DE SOMERI."GRAININGFOLD"IS EXAMPLE OF MEDIAEVAL FARM,AND "COPPED HALL"OF TUDOR YEOMANS HOUSE. JUNCTION OF A29 AND A264 IS RECORDED AS FIVE OAKS IN 1740.IN 1940'S LONDON SCHOOLS WERE EVACUATED TO CAMPSITES ON COOPERS AND WEDGES FARMS.
